newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK WATCHDOG SETS FINES IN DELTA SCANDAL.
newsitem.headline: GREEK WATCHDOG SETS FINES IN DELTA SCANDAL.

text.p: Greece's capital market commission announced fines on brokers and individuals alleged to have been involved in the Delta Securities scandal which closed the Athens bourse last year.

It based its decision on audits by three international auditing firms called in after the scandal rocked the bourse and stopped trading for four days in November 1996, the commission said in a statement.

The commission sent a written reprimand to bourse members N. Devletoglou, state National Bank subsidiary National Securities and Kappa Securities for "failing to exercise the required due diligence to protect the market from the consequences of pre-arranged trades."

"All the above brokerages were found to violate the present code of conduct and it was decided to place them under a three-month probation as regards the articles of the code of conduct," the commission said in a statement.
The commission is continuing to examine the findings of the audit for additional possible violations, it said.

"The commission's board decided to apply administrative penalties on individuals and legal entities involved in pre-arranged, manipulative trades of the Tryfon, Delta Securities and Georgakis groups," it said.
It also fined the following individuals:
1. Vasilis Kostopoulos was fined 150 million drachmas for alleged violations of insider trading laws and allegedly disseminating false information on trades involving shares of Magrizos.
2. Constantine Georgakis was fined 150 million drachmas for alleged violations on insider trading regulations related to trading in shares of Atemke and Parnassos.
3. Constantine Varipobiotis was fined 100 million drachmas on insider trading violations, disseminating false information on trades involving shares of Parnassos.
4. Spyridon Yasafakis and Emmanuel Hatzakis were fined 60 million and 40 million drachmas respectively for insider trading on shares of Magrizos.
5. Evangelia and Chrysoula Georgaki were fined 10 million drachmas each for trades on shares of Parnassos and Atemke.
6. Ioannis Marcopoulos and Lambros Fragos were fined 25 and 15 million respectively for trades in shares of Parnassos. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
